meanings.definition: To board a bus or other vehicle.
meanings.sent1: I embus the school bus every morning.
meanings.sent2: She embuses the train to get to work on time.
meanings.sent3: The kids embus the big yellow bus with excitement.
meanings.sent4: As the doors opened, they embused the crowded bus like a wave.
meanings.sent5: He embuses the bus with a smile, ready for the day ahead.

meanings.definition: To put into or onto a bus or other vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The driver embuses the luggage into the storage compartment.
meanings.sent2: They embus the passengers onto the tour bus.
meanings.sent3: The team embuses their equipment onto the team bus.
meanings.sent4: She carefully embuses the fragile items onto the shuttle.
meanings.sent5: He embuses the boxes onto the delivery truck efficiently.
